title: EU-Latin America and Caribbean Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems
executive_summary: The EU-Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems aim to foster collaboration between the European Union, MERCOSUR countries, and Chile to enhance sustainable agricultural practices. These dialogues, supported by the EU's Farm to Fork Strategy, focus on addressing climate change, biodiversity loss, and environmental degradation through strategic partnerships. The second workshop, held on May 16-17, 2022, facilitated discussions among policymakers and stakeholders on sustainable livestock production, food loss and waste, and soil health. Key figures emphasized the importance of the EU-MERCOSUR Free Trade Agreement and the need for inclusive food systems that align with international sustainability goals. The initiative will culminate in a bi-regional conference, promoting ongoing dialogue and the development of public-private partnerships to transition towards resilient food systems globally.
characteristics: The EU-LAC Dialogues focus on promoting sustainable food systems through strategic partnerships and constructive exchanges of ideas among stakeholders from the EU, MERCOSUR, and Chile.
The workshops address key issues such as sustainable agriculture, food loss and waste, and soil health, aiming to identify common strategies for collaboration.
The initiative is part of the EU's Farm to Fork Strategy, emphasizing the importance of cooperation in tackling climate change and environmental degradation.
The dialogues involve participation from policymakers, private sector representatives, and various ministries, fostering inclusive and participatory processes.
The series of workshops culminates in a bi-regional conference, reinforcing the commitment to ongoing dialogue and partnership development.

Political Actors: Ministries of Agriculture and Environment of the MERCOSUR countries

practical_applications: The EU-Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems, which include a series of workshops aimed at promoting collaboration on sustainable agricultural practices.
The EU-Mercosur and Chile Workshop held on May 16-17, 2022, focused on sustainable agriculture and food systems, involving representatives from the EU, MERCOSUR countries, and Chile.
Ongoing development of public and private partnerships to facilitate the transition to sustainable and resilient food systems, as agreed upon during the EU-Mercosur and Chile Workshop.
The implementation of the EU Farm to Fork Strategy as a guiding framework for sustainable food systems in collaboration with MERCOSUR countries and Chile.
The establishment of a bi-regional Association Agreement, which includes a Free Trade Agreement between the EU and MERCOSUR, aimed at enhancing cooperation on sustainable food systems.
commitments: Conduct a total of four sub-regional workshops on sustainable food systems, concluding with a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.

commitment_details.text: Conduct a total of four sub-regional workshops on sustainable food systems, concluding with a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.

kpi_list.kpi_text: These Dialogues will consist of a total of four sub-regional workshops, concluding with a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.
kpi_list.target_description: Conduct four sub-regional workshops and one bi-regional conference
kpi_list.measurement_method: Count of workshops and conference held

kpi_list.kpi_text: The parties agreed to continue the dialogue and work together on the development of public and private partnerships and sharing of good practices.
kpi_list.target_description: Develop public and private partnerships and share good practices
kpi_list.measurement_method: Assessment of partnerships established and practices shared

kpi_list.kpi_text: The EU aims to develop Green Alliances on sustainable food systems with all its partners at bilateral, regional, and multilateral levels.
kpi_list.target_description: Establish Green Alliances for sustainable food systems
kpi_list.measurement_method: Number of alliances formed and their effectiveness

kpi_list.kpi_text: The Chilean government seeks to promote fair mechanisms focused on the rights of people working in rural areas.
kpi_list.target_description: Implement fair mechanisms for rural workers' rights
kpi_list.measurement_method: Evaluation of mechanisms implemented and their impact

kpi_list.kpi_text: The EU and MERCOSUR Free Trade agreement, part of a bi-regional Association Agreement, which is still pending to be signed and ratified.
kpi_list.target_description: Sign and ratify the EU-MERCOSUR Free Trade Agreement
kpi_list.measurement_method: Status of agreement signing and ratification

top_actors.name: European Union
top_actors.justification: The European Union is central to the dialogues on sustainable food systems, being the primary organizer and a key player in shaping policies and strategies discussed in the workshops.

top_actors.name: MERCOSUR countries
top_actors.justification: MERCOSUR countries are significant participants in the dialogues, representing a major regional bloc that collaborates with the EU on sustainable agriculture and food systems.

top_actors.name: Chile
top_actors.justification: Chile plays a crucial role in the dialogues, contributing its perspectives and strategies on sustainable food systems, and is actively involved in the discussions and initiatives.

top_themes.name: Sustainable Food Systems
top_themes.justification: This theme is central to the document's main message, which focuses on the collaboration between the EU and LAC countries to promote sustainable food systems. The majority of the content is dedicated to discussing strategies, dialogues, and workshops aimed at achieving sustainability in food production and consumption.

top_themes.name: EU-LAC Cooperation
top_themes.justification: The theme of cooperation between the EU and LAC is crucial as it underpins the dialogues and workshops mentioned in the documents. It highlights the strategic partnerships necessary for addressing global challenges such as climate change and food security, making it highly relevant to the objectives outlined.

top_themes.name: Climate Change and Environmental Sustainability
top_themes.justification: This theme is important as it relates to the broader context of the dialogues, emphasizing the need for sustainable practices in agriculture to combat climate change and environmental degradation. It is a key objective that aligns with international commitments, such as the 2030 Agenda and the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
